com.github.rolecraftdev.command

Class CommandHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.rolecraftdev.command.CommandHelper

  • public final class CommandHelper
extends Object
    This class provides various utility methods for dealing with commands in Rolecraft.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int COMMANDS_PER_PAGE
      The amount of commands to display on a single page in a help message sent to a user.

      Displays a 'help message' to the given command sender, which consists of a list of commands, containing their usage as well as a brief description as to each command's functionality.

      Gets a sublist of a specific page within the given list, using a page number provided in the arguments array and using the given amount of elements per page to decide the cut-off point for a page.

    • Method Detail

      • getGuildFromArgs

        public static Guild getGuildFromArgs(GuildManager mgr,
                     org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                     String guildArg)
        Gets a Guild from the given argument. If there is no argument given, the method will attempt to get the Guild of the sender of the command, if said sender is a player. Otherwise, the sender is alerted that they must specify a Guild's name. The sender is also alerted if they specify a Guild that doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        mgr - - The GuildManager to work with
        sender - - The CommandSender to send error messages to
        guildArg - - The argument which contains the Guild's name, or null if there isn't one
        Returns:
        The Guild specified by the argument, or the sender's Guild if guildArg is null, and else null

      • getPageFromArgs

        public static <T> List<T> getPageFromArgs(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                          List<T> list,
                          String pageArg,
                          int elementsPerPage)
        Gets a sublist of a specific page within the given list, using a page number provided in the arguments array and using the given amount of elements per page to decide the cut-off point for a page.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - The type of the given List
        Parameters:
        sender - - The CommandSender to send error messages to
        list - - The List to get a specific page of elements from
        pageArg - - The page number argument as a string
        elementsPerPage - - The amount of elements on each page
        Returns:
        The page

      • sendRankInfo

        public static void sendRankInfo(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                Guild guild,
                GuildRank rank)
        Sends the given CommandSender a basic overview of the given GuildRank within the given Guild
        Parameters:
        sender - - The CommandSender to send messages to
        guild - - The Guild the GuildRank is part of
        rank - - The GuildRank to send information about

      • displayCommandList

        public static void displayCommandList(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                      List<pw.ian.albkit.command.CommandHandler> commands,
                      String[] args,
                      int startIndex)
        Displays a 'help message' to the given command sender, which consists of a list of commands, containing their usage as well as a brief description as to each command's functionality. The page of subcommands is taken from the arguments if any are provided.
        Parameters:
        sender - - The CommandSender to send the help messages to
        commands - - A List of sub-commands, used for sending help to the CommandSender
        args - - The arguments provided by the user to request for help. For example, if the user would've typed /command help 1, the arguments would be { "help", "1" }
        startIndex - - The first index in args which can be used as a page number for this method. For example, in the array { "help", "1" }, this would be 1, as "help" is an argument which was parsed by the CommandExecutor
